While Wellbutrin (bupropion) is not typically associated with an increased risk of serotonin syndrome, as it primarily acts on dopamine and norepinephrine, there is still a need for caution when combining it with other serotonergic medications.

In the patient's medication list, the primary serotonergic medication is Cymbalta (duloxetine), a selective serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI). Although the risk of serotonin syndrome is relatively low when combining Wellbutrin (bupropion) with Cymbalta (duloxetine), it is still essential to monitor the patient closely and educate them on the signs and symptoms of serotonin syndrome.
